title: New: Giant Fang – Golden Age
content:
Glasgow has long been a melting pot for new music, but its self contained live scene, has to me at least, been one of its main constraints and downfalls.

Bands often fall into a seemingly inescapable circle, roaming the local toilet venues, year after year and single release after single release, their sounds limited to only a select few local music fans. With CHVRCHES and younger siblings Prides trading the live circuit for the mysterious online approach, fame and fortune soon followed.

Fellow Glasgow resident, Douglas Wilson, a.k.a, GIANT FANG (capital letters must be the ‘in’ thing), only has a modest 2,000 listens on his latest release and seems to have slipped under the radar slightly. Comparisons to his previously mentioned contemporaries are likely, but there’s something much grander to his sound. Like a galactic Bruce Springsteen crashing head on with M83, “Golden Age” conjures images of a modern day John Hughes classic, with delicate falsetto vocals dangled over a wall of lovely synth-iness.

2014, step up and take notice.

His new single Golden Age available now via POP unLTD
